sen.j: なお、当初は東一条殿（ひがしいちじょうどの）と呼ばれていたが、邸内に撫子や萩が咲き乱れていたことから、「花山院」と呼ばれるようになったとされている（『古今著聞集』）。
sen.e: At first it had been called 'Higashi-Ichijo Dono (the resident by Eastern Ichijo Street)', later its nickname gradually changed to 'Kazanin (the resident by the mountain covered with flower)' for the flourishing flowers of pink and hagi in the estate (according to "Kokon Chomon-Ju").
